com.highsoft.highcharts.Common

Class HIGradient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIGradient

  • public class HIGradient
extends java.lang.Object
    Definition of the gradient, similar to SVG: object literal holds start position (x1, y1) and the end position (x2, y2) relative to the shape, where 0 means top/left and 1 is bottom/right. All positions are floats between 0 and 1.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HIGradient()
      Default constructor.
      HIGradient(float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2)
      Sets positions to the desired values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HIGradient

        public HIGradient()
        Default constructor. Sets positions values to default ones: x1 = 0, x2 = 0, y1 = 0, y2 = 1

      • HIGradient

        public HIGradient(float x1,
                  float y1,
                  float x2,
                  float y2)
        Sets positions to the desired values.
        Parameters:
        x1 - must be in [0..1] range
        x2 - must be in [0..1] range
        y1 - must be in [0..1] range
        y2 - must be in [0..1] range
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a param does not comply
